doc:
Fanny Brough https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanny_Brough 0 Not to be confused with actress Julia Marlowe who early in her career was billed as Fanny Brough.Frances "Fanny" Whiteside Brough (7 July 1852 – 30 November 1914) was a Paris-born British stage actress who came from a literary and dramatic family. She is remembered especially for her many comedy roles performed over a four decade-long career. Brough was acting professionally in London by 1870. She played in a variety of comic and dramatic roles in Britain with several companies and toured America early in the 20th century with Charles Hawtrey. Her career reached a high point in 1902 with her creation of the title role of Kitty Warren in George Bernard Shaw's Mrs. Warren's Profession. She continued to act until shortly before her death. Not to_be_confused with actress_Julia_Marlowe who early in her_career was_billed as Fanny_Brough.Frances " Fanny " Whiteside_Brough ( 7_July_1852 – 30_November_1914 ) was a_Paris-born_British_stage_actress who came from a_literary_and_dramatic_family . She is remembered especially for her_many_comedy_roles performed over a_four_decade-long_career . Brough was_acting professionally in London by 1870 . She played in a_variety of comic_and_dramatic_roles in Britain with several_companies and toured America_early in the_20th_century with Charles_Hawtrey . Her_career reached a_high_point in 1902 with her_creation of the_title_role of Kitty_Warren in George_Bernard_Shaw 's_Mrs._Warren 's_Profession . She continued_to_act until shortly before her_death .
